titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of Education and World Affairs records, 1961-1971
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Yamada

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-09-11T15:38-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

change.item: Inventory of collection created by Rachel Yamada.

did.abstract: Governing documents, minutes, correspondence, memoranda, reports, and printed matter relating to international education from Education and World Affairs, a private American nonprofit organization created in 1962 for the promotion of internationalism in education. Education and World Affairs is the predecessor of the International Council for Educational Development.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Education and World Affairs records, 1961-1971, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2015.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Education and World Affairs was a private American nonprofit organization created in 1962 to study, analyze, and assist in strengthening the international teaching, research, and service dimensions of colleges and universities in the United States. The organization is the predecessor of the International Council for Educational Development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Governing documents, minutes, correspondence, memoranda, reports, and printed matter relating to international education from Education and World Affairs, a private American nonprofit organization created in 1962 for the promotion of internationalism in education. Education and World Affairs is the predecessor of the International Council for Educational Development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, records, memoranda, notes, proposals, and meeting minutes from Education and World Affairs.
